newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: FOCUS- Dutch Aug inflation falls to 1.9 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: FOCUS- Dutch Aug inflation falls to 1.9 pct yr/yr.

text.p: The Dutch consumer price index (CPI) fell a provisional 0.1 percent in August from July, giving a 1.9 percent year-on-year rise, the Central Bureau of Statistics (CBS) said on Friday.
Economists at major Dutch banks had forecast consumer inflation to be between 2.0 and 2.3 percent, versus a revised July figure of 2.2 percent.
But the CBS said that the surprise fall could be a one-off.
"For the moment, the fall in consumer prices seems to be an incidental development," it said.
Prices for vegetables, fruit and potatoes fell because of favourable weather, while clothes were more expensive due to the introduction of the new winter collection, it said.
However, while clothes prices were not rising as fast as last year, some of the price hikes could trickle through into September, the CBS said.
Consumer prices in other categories remained mostly stable.
The gap between Dutch and German inflation remained at a steady 0.5 percentage points. German August inflation was pegged at 1.4 percent yr/yr from 1.6 percent in July.
